titleStmt.title: Reasons humbly offered for excepting the rivers of Elbe, Weser, and Eyder, out of the Bill for a general liberty of exporting the woollen manufactures of this kingdom.

notesStmt.note: The case of the Company of Merchant Adventurers to preserve their liberties and privileges at Hamburg and its environs.
In this edition the title takes up five lines; the text is substantially different and the final word of the first line is "several".
Wing does not differentiate between the two different editions which exist.
Date from Wing; NUC gives date as [1694?] and the latest date in text is "this last year 1693".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
